Time dependent propensities of diffusion reaction processes.

We assume the cell to be a cylinder whose volume is growing exponentially, with its radius constant. The volume at the end of the cell cycle, , where is the initial volume at the beginning of the cell cycle and the time of the previous division event. The time evolution of the volume writes

We can calculate the evolution of the cell's surface area ,

where is the initial length of the cylinder and the radius of the cylinder.

The expression of the rates of reaction for the diffusion processes in and out the cell, are given by

where we included in the diffusion coefficient .

Parameters:
tc [in] The duration of the cell cycle.
x1 [in] State vector of the cell.
x2 [in] State vector of the milieu.
V0 [in] Volume of the cell at the beginning of the cell cycle (constant).
Vext [in] Volume of the external milieu at time t.
t [in] Time t of the evaluation of the propensities.
t0 [in] Time of the previous cell division (time of cell's birth).
tc [in] Duration of the cell cycle.
a [out] Array of the computed propensities.
